reviewText:
As much as I want to love this game because it helps cope with RO nostalgia, it takes so many steps back in what we're used to having on an MMORPG that whatever enjoyment I get from it is quickly overtaken by the myriad bad features and issues it has.

From the issues with mob density (Not nearly enough enemies for multiple parties to grind in one channel), to backwards restrictions (Really? Can't trade cash shop items between characters, or even silver?) and severe optimization issues/lag... it's not something I can recommend to others.

That said, I sincerely hope that these issues are addressed in time, because right now I get the impression that the game is simply bleeding players at a fast rate (at least the amount of people you see in otherwise popular spots in the EU server has dramatically decreased).

reviewText:
A Phoenix's Small Guide on Tree of Savior at this current date:

Pros!
Seriously one of the most inspired music BGMs I've heard in any MMO ever. With the exception of a few, I'd seriously buy this game's album and not regret it.
Very intuitive class creation system. Not every mix-matched build or combination will work, but it helps create varied builds between people and freshness when it comes to creating multiple characters.
Great visuals. The game knows tone, and knows when to be happy and prideful, or dark and borderline ambient.
While others may disagree, I like the story, though it isn't magnificently written. This game gets dark, and there will be more times when you can't save others from meeting demise.
Aside from hiccups, the controls are very concise and the game allows multiple interfaces to play it: (Keyboard, Mouse, and Gamepads.)

Cons!
Game is fairly buggy. As of now, some skills and attack may register odd not due to lag, but the nature of the attack itself.
As expected for a global/international game, there is lag. But it is much more than you expect.
Optimization of game is fairly poor. My computer's rig isn't powerful, but it's been known that the game runs on a single core within your computer, so performance is certainly lacking.
Character Customization is fairly lacking thus far. I expect this to be adressed in the future as this isn't a hard thing to fix with time.
The game has a fair amount of linear gameplay, but at the same time one doesn't have to level up the same as others. It's not a sandbox, it is a grinder.

All in all, if you particularly grind based games, I recommend giving it a try and seeing if you like it. It is not for everyone, but for those who end up liking it will get hooked as the core of the game is honestly FANTASTIC. Right now though, lag and bugs may hinder gaming experience. Try it, and support it if you can. This game is not perfect, but it is great and a brilliant way to shine some light on this stale MMO market. If you can get friends for the journey, it may also be worth making a group for it.

Good luck, and may the goddesses stay with you.

reviewText:
It‚Äôs a good ambiance mmo with colorfull art.

They did not try to just copy another popular mmo to make the maximum profit with the minimum effort which I appreciate a lot. Of course it hard to reinvent the whole genre, but this game does feel different in its own way.

Small production team so it does have some hiccups. But I‚Äôve not experience anything close to a deal breaker.

Some people say its alot of grinding but If you complete all quests chains and do you daily dungeons you can get by just fine.

It is best played with a controller, mouse support has been added later due to community asking for it but it has some problems.

The combat system uses a lot of ground effect skills, it revolves around positioning your character and the monsters at the right place at the right time. AI is really nothing to be impressed but sometimes the enemies stop before running into your damage area and wait till it dissolves which I find amusing.

A lot of classes to choose from to build your character. You can focus skills to get max impact or spread to get more skills and manage cooldowns.

On a down side it is really not very challenging. I am not late game yet, lv172 as I am writing this and I really did not have to put much effort into anything. But I am not playing to be the best, I am playing to have fun and this game is fun to me.

reviewText:
Product received for free

I had high expectations for this, even tho i didnt want to buy early access i was pretty hyped. Now i am happy i didnt. Game has a lot of flaws, most major atm are server issues, euro server is not even that populated and it constantly lags, i am playing archer and i do double dps when it doesnt lag.
‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• auction system - you cant buy/sell anything for 72 hours when you start to play, when you finally can start selling tooltips on items you put on auction(average price and stuff) are completely wrong, you need to check every material(and after 72 hours i had about ~90 of them) manually. But that isnt everything, even if you manage to sell something you need to wait 48 hours to get your silver. This makes absolutely no sense to me.
Other major issue is forced party play. Being in a group gives you more xp then solo. In full group you can get 450% more xp per monster, considering half of the areas are dead/close to dead this makes no sense again. Why should solo gameplay be punished in a grinding game, i have no idea.
Next issue is dungeon queue. Considering you get even more bonus xp(600%) if you dont make premade group for dungeon, you need to queue for some to get good xp. Well, 99% of the time you just gonna stare at 'Searching for party' window for hours if you have nothing else to do. Also game has no info on dungeon locations, but that is tolerable considering queue mechanic itself. Queue should be long distance and not require you to wait at dungeon entrance, period. Oh and 1 more thing about dungeons, 90% of the time you get nothing, there are total 2(+1 when you get premium token) entrances COMBINED per day. Actually its not that bad since you cant even find group for 1 dungeon, lol.

Now about good stuff, art/locations/quests are actually pretty enjoyable, characters are really cute.
But considering party play will probably stay same and I am really not a fan of grinding normal monsters with other people, i have doubts i am gonna enjoy playing this game further.

reviewText:
I played this game early access. I don't terribly recommend it, but at the same time, I don't unrecommend it either. I'm basically neutral.

It all comes down to one thing:
I feel this game is toothless.
Perhaps I played a class that just brushed everything aside with just one move and I should've picked a class that actually struggled.
One defining moment happened to me: I entered a level 50 area when I was level 30 and overkilled some enemies with one move. Then I almost died in two hits, but I got to run out, so I was okay by the end of that...
My interest dwindled and was lost and I just stopped playing.


Now, again, I played this game during early access... Maybe they changed somethings that'll make this review pointless. but that's a good thing. There are some good ideas here and perhaps it'll blossom into something that challenges another MMO, like DFO (I guess, since I do play that) to the spotlight.

Good luck!

A quite addictive MMORPG. The linear progression may be it's biggest fault, but it's still a great game to play with friends. reviewText:
Product received for free

I don't know why this game has such mixed reviews. If you like action-based MMOs, I highly recommend for you to at least try this someday, since it is free now.

I have only played one day, on the day of release so far.
I've played both keyboard and gamepad mode and both were smooth once you get used to it. I loved how they used the similar gamepad hotkey key-mapping and UI as FFXIV.

The combat system is really fun to me, it is similar to games like Lunia maybe. It feels kind of like a fusion of Ragnarok Online 1 and Lunia.
It's action-based and you can attack while jumping. As a wizard, you can jump, then immediately press attack as you start the jump, and keep repeating this to keep yourself 100% mobile while attacking. This is great for bosses.
Also, I only played a few seconds on a brand new swordsman and noticed their normal attack does splash AOE damage to multiple monsters if they're close enough.

---

The problems I had, and greatly hope they will improve in the future are:

- The restrictive chat system and bot spamming. There is no specific filter/player mute system, so you cannot prevent shouts from appearing in most chat tabs... and the chat history keeps jumping and not scrolling properly from all the bot spam... so you cannot really read what your party/friend is saying.
There was a bot in town in the very center, spamming a tower of chat, and you could not see anything behind them. This was very confusing as a newbie, and all I could do was use the Report" button
date: but that wouldn't really solve anything if a GM isn't on to kick them right away
recommended: unless you're gonna wait however-many days in that spot. I'd much prefer a blacklist/mute option.\nAlso

reviewText:
First of, I absolutely LOVE Tree of Savior. It really had a ton of potential to be a great game. Unfortunately the company running it has caused problems and ruined their own game. The combat style is fun, but allows every player to afk farm certain mobs (due to static respawn points) by simply setting a book on their attack key. There is no forced logouts, which means (you guessed it) bots are RAMPANT. Half the palyers you meet will seemingly teleport around your screen and attack mobs before you can, or you are simply fighting them for spawns. This problem is awful from level 15-40. The bots seem to die off a bit after that, but I haven't made it to max level to see what that is like.

IMC has done NOTHING about their botting problem, nor about the pretty toxic playerbase whom are pretty rude at the best of times, I can only imagine their attitude is due to their profits. Someone is supplying these people with tokens, be it themselves or others, and they are getting paid. The economy is a joke, and the restrictions placed on trading an item or using their auction house are god awful.

I really enjoy their game, but until the botting problems and gold spammer problems are fixed a bit, I can't recommend this game to other people, which is such a shame.

If you made it this far, I'll share some of the things I love and hate.
-There is quite a lot to do

-The art and music are AMAZING. Totally my style.

-The combat is fun, but if you lag with a melee class you will be VERY annoyed in short order. (Most of my lag is due to my poor internet connection, not the servers but the punishment from the lag is totally lost melee attacks. Like, I attacked, I saw my character swing his weapon... and NOTHING happens. Unless you attack 2+ times, this will happen with a bad connection and you will almost always lose that first attack.)

-Real-money is the ONLY option for resetting your skills or stat points. This is good because it means your choices matter, but this is really bad because it means new players are required to research everything BEFORE starting the game, or simply picking a cookie-cutter build that walks you through each step.

-Sadly, you are locked into your class choices. If you pick the wrong class, or the class you picked turns out to not be so fun ONE time... Guess what? Better start over. Even if you are level 200 and simply made a bad call or thought something
worked a different way.

-There are very few resources for information. I know this is due to how new the game is but, ecause of the beta testing, a lot of information you find is old and has since been changed. Even trying to research a good class selection or which stats to pump at max level is next to impossible. Which is why I feel being locked into class choices is such a bad idea.

reviewText:
I love this game. The art style, the setting, the gameplay, the class system and strategy, etc.
It's fresh. I never played RO or RO2 - but the game is fresh and pretty smooth for a launch despite some poor optimization.

I know little to nothing about IMC but I think they're doing a good job - even with the pricing/DLC complaints people have.

Having said that - I am giving this game a positive review but can say that there need to be several MAJOR changes before it hits release.

The US is the only country that doesn't require a social security input in order to play - so having said that. We are the primary market for the gold sellers... what that means is that the game gets FLOODED with gold sellers and bots which damn near ruins the experience.

Please make this game buy to play" and consider revising some of the ingame uneccessary restrictions.
Free to play makes a lot of sense and is an attractive incentive to try the game overseas - but not here.
Here it makes the game a marketplace and invites the gold sellers to take advantage.

Give it a try for free when it hits launch - but know that it would be worth (and a lot better) a $15-20 fee to purchase with a cosmetic cash shop."

reviewText:
I can not in full faith recommend this game to anyone. The game has some huge fundamental problems.

The game features several different controls depending on how you want to play. It's great that they offer the ability to change on the fly at any point. However, it does come with the problem of things like keyboard prompts appearing while playing with a controller.

The gameplay itself is rather bland. It's slightly more active than a typical M-M-O game, but still lacking. The addition of awful server lag every time I played didn't help in this regard. It always felt like too many people were in a channel even if it displayed the capacity as being on the lower end. Sometimes you would also get thrown into the high capacity ones for seemingly no reason.

Towns have plenty of silver spammers already. The speech bubbles that appear with their world chat spam will cover the UI / menus and be incredibly fustrating to deal with on the first encounter. Thankfully you can turn these global chat bubbles off and save yourself some pain. HOWEVER, the worst part is that the bubbles will actually LAG your game, and what does disabling them do? Only hides them. YOU WILL STILL LAG. I kid you not.

Tree of Savior quickly runs out of quests for it's newbies. Around LVL 30 you'll hit a wall of a lack of quest lines in the starting area of your choice. Now you can go to the other starting area and progress through that one as well, but variety is pretty much non-existant as far as I could tell.

The class system is where the meat of the game is. Plenty of options to choose and pick from.

The game is free though and worth taking a look if you have the data to spare. Honestly to me it's just another MMORPG to throw in the bucket. I'd recommend Path of Exile if you want deep and complex character builds with RPG elements. It's free to play as well.

reviewText:
If you're trying it free-to-play be ready for disappointment.  The developers in their infinite wisdom made it pay-to-win by disabling most BASIC mmo functions for the free player.  These are some of the notable downsides:

1. Can't trade with other players
2. Can't buy premium items (they won't even allow you to buy TP currency with real money yet!)
3. Can only have 1 item on the marketplace at a time
4. Takes 30 min - 2 hours for market item to show up on the market
5. Takes 48 hours to retrieve money from a marketplace sale
6. 30% marketplace commission screws your ability to profit or even trade items with friends via marketplace effectively

I'm sure there will be a lot more downsides like the many bugs that are still present and the idiotic AoE Ratio stat (your AoE skills won't hit everything in range because they cap how many mobs you can hit depending on the AoE Ratio of the ability...nothing like slamming Earthquake down on 12 monsters and hitting 5 of them while the other 7 punch you in the face).

Lots of potential since the art and music is great but at this point I'd rather go back to RO 1 than deal with this currently gimped game.

reviewText:
People are being so damn harsh with this game!
I've played 10 hours so far and I'm level 26 and this game is absolutely FUN!
I love the fact that you can talk to every single NPC, there are lots of subquests, the skills are really varied and some require tactics and not just smash and kill, the graphic and music are amazing, I'm basically never bored.
The true grind part is if you want to complete collections but they are absolutely NOT necessary to keep going on with the story so I don't really see why people complain about grind. All games require to kill mobs but BELIEVE ME, I played games where the grind was WAY more serious than the TOS one. (I'll just say Warframe as an example because grind is everything in that game yet I still love it.)
This game is really good played with friends too because if you make a party, quests where you have to collect items become much easier but if you play solo EVERY BOSS I encountered so far was perfectly soloable. Maybe it's because I'm a Pyromancer? I don't think so but if you have trouble it's really easy to make a party and find other players. There are always at least 5 parties in the busiest channels and a couple in the less crowded ones.
Another great thing is in fact, the CHANNELS because if a channel is too crowded or if you can't find the right mob, you can always change channel and find a less crowded one where monsters will respawn.
I've heard many people complain about lag but I'm having no problem so far and my PC is kinda old too. If you experience lag you should change some settings, go to a less crowded channel and close unnecessary applications but, seriously, it's a 2D game, if you can't even support this kind of game just go buy a new PC and shut up!
There are many interesting mechanics that I still didn't even try yet and the game has just been released so I have faith many good things have yet to come but my overall experience has been extremely positive!
I've played this game for a whole day and I absolutely did not feel bored! It's been so long since I last played such a good MMO where the atmosphere and mechanics are so smooth you would just play without stop. (GW2 and FFXIV were my latest favourite MMOs)
I love the fact that there are many subclasses so you can choose your favourite style but BEWARE, the game is not meant for EVERY subclass to be played but instead, it's made so you can create really rounded but specialized characters. You need to decide which classes you want to go for beforehand and you'll find out the gameplay will be very smooth! I was disappointed by this at first because I wanted to play every subclass but then I realized it was absolutely unnecessary because if you take a close look at each class's skills (and NOT ONLY THE ATTIRE because let's be sincere, we all want good looking outfits haha) you'll see you will not want to play every class but instead get better at a couple ones that compliment each other well.
Everyone has it's own preferred build but you can always create a new one. :)
Another thing I love is the fact that you can jump around and some places can be reached only with jumps. The game encourages you to explore all the map to find hidden treasure chests and I think it's amazing because it's not like other games where you could just avoid half of the map and go on. You even have an Adventure Diary (I don't really remember how it's called) that keeps track of everything you did and sometimes you get rewards so everything you do in this game is worth doing!
I guess the only bad thing about this game are the gold sellers but seriously, EVERY GAME has them so just ignore them or just switch to normal chat so you won't read them.
Anyway, I seriously recommend everyone to at least TRY THIS GAME and do not be discouraged by the reviews because it really all depends on your tastes! I was discouraged by the reviews but then I tried the game and loved it so you should too! Trust me! :)
(Besides, I think to better enjoy a game you need to have a bit of fantasy too. If you empathize with your character a bit everything will be more beautiful. If you just call you character Dumbdog5" and just play to reach endgame and troll people in PvP then of course you won't like the game.)
So rembember
recommended: THEN JUDGE!\n\nI hope you found this review useful! Happy gaming! :D"

reviewText:
Quick and dirty in the games current state:

If you need something F2P\MMO and have 100-200 hours to blow OR have friends that would like to party it is fantastic!  If your play style is more than that of a hobbyist or filthy casual‚Ä¶ You may get very frustrated with market queues, trade caps (Token users) and constantly trying to find a way to work the market\game in your favor at later levels.


Pros:

-Music is great!
-Graphics are smooth and polished.
-Class & Job(s) combinations are fun to try out with awesome abilities. (Make sure you visit ToS fan based sites   before you finalize your build unless you want to purchase a skill reset potion)
-Leveling 1-165 is very enjoyable, fast and tons of content (If you participate is dungeon parties and talk to ALL NPCs for quests)
-For a new F2P MMO, it very surprising you can get 200+ hours so easily and keep sticking with it.




Cons:

-Gold spammers (Always a constant fight, but they trying to address it)
-Bots ‚Ä¶. Bots‚Ä¶.More Bots‚Ä¶..
-Mouse\Keyboard interaction with quest items in some cases fails. #TIP: You‚Äôll need to switch to controller or keyboard only mode to interact with items or walk past certain areas.
-LAG - Multi-tiered zones w/ Elevators will lag the life out of you!
-Classes that use summon or pets have to deal with the dumbest AI I have seen probably since Everquest days (WTF!!)


**Overall this is recommended for anyone that needs a quick fix of gaming and doesn‚Äôt mind dropping a few $$ on in game tokens when available or farming items and materials to purchase them via the market.

reviewText:
Most of the negative reviews are a direct response from the very dedicated players to the publisher's inexperience at handling the innate problems that come with F2P games (goldsellers, and balancing monitization with actual cash flow and keeping the pay 2 win aspect low) as seen by the high play time on most of the negitive reviews.

Combat is extremly satisfying, and requires quite a bit of thought in larger fights. It's far from the typical tab-target that the screenshots and videos imply.

At the time of writing this, the pay2win is very low. You have a few restrictions placed on selling things via trading post that can be removed by purchasing a $20 item, which itself can also be purchased on the trading post. There's 3 hat slots that can have stat enchants added to them with scrolls that cost a small amount of premium currency. You passively gain premium currency every day, which caps out at 5. The cap can be temporarly raised to 8 though guild vs guild pvp, allowing you to buy said enchant scrolls. Pre-enchanted gear can be freely bought from other plays on the trading post.

This game is still absolutly fun to play, and I've definitly gotten more value out of it than the $10 I payed for pre-release access. So far the game seems rather themepark, but questing is incredabily simplified, allowing you to focus solely on the flow of combat or quest mechanics instead of the poorly translated story filler you don't care about. The storyline itself is well spaced out and easy to follow (unlike most other asian MMOs.)

9/10 definitly one of the best early game experiences I've had in an MMO.

reviewText:
Instead of doing a Pros/Cons list, I will try to summarize my experience so far with the game. I'll let you decide whether these are Pros or Cons.

- Great visuals and artwork. The game looks great!

- Soundtrack is really good and blends well with the game. It can get repetitive on some maps though (some techno/trance songs for example).

- The game is incredible poor optimized. Even with a high end spec the FPS will tank for no apparent reason.

- Despite the Staff already made some modifications to the original F2P plan, non premium players will be heavily restricted on some aspects of the game that really makes no sense (ie cannot share items between own characters/alts, can only post one item on the Auction House).

- Cash shop seems imbalanced and expensive for some items (Token or premium membership cost about U$S 18 a month).

- Combat engine is great, but watered down by skills with really long cooldown and dull enemies.

- Many if not most of the skills scales poorly, rendering them useless in the late game.

- Monsters can cc you for days. There are no diminishing returns on monsters cc.

- There were several issues with the servers since launch. Even though there were some improvements, there are still some problems with the servers (as of 5/6/2016 many SA players cannot even log into the game for example).

- Classes are not really balanced. This could be expected from a game that just released, but after the beta and so much feedback from the users, you would expect a better job from the devs (there were some ninja nerfs that made no sense at all for example).

- Staff handles the communication in a weird way: sometimes they are very vocal about what they are doing, why they are doing it, and so on. Some others they don't say a word for days.

- Monster spawn rate is awful. You have to literally wait for two minutes for each wave of monsters. Also, monsters respawn in the same spot, which translate into parties sitting down on the very same spot por hours, waiting to the mobs to spawn, wiping them out, sitting for two minutes straight and starting all over again.

- The game is extremely linear for the first 200 levels. This is not really a problem for solo players, but after starting for the third of fourth time, it gets really old and boring.

- Social aspect of the game is lacking: this may be for several reasons, but the fact that the game is ridiculously linear makes it hard to party up with friends that fall behind.

- Itemization is lackluster at best. There isn't a big pool of interesting and exiting items to choose from.

- Mouse controls are a nightmare sometimes. It makes you wonder if they actually played and tested the game before release.

- The game provides you with many and very interesting to choose from. However, if you don't do a lot of previous research, you have no way to modify your choice.



I'm going to leave the bot / RMS spammers out of the list, because they are a plague among ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•mes these days. However, if this is something that concerns you, please be aware that there are a lot of bots / gold spammers ingame. Like A LOT.

If you are interested on this game I would recommend until it goes F2P as in its current status I wouldn't say its worth buying. It has a lot of potential, but IMC games needs to start listening to the community feedback if they want this game to survive.

reviewText:
This game is not perfect but I highly recommend it.

Pros:
-Art style.
-Music.
-Class diversity.
-Map exploration.
-Quest are not marked in map so you need to look for them instead of just follow the main quest.
-Costumes.

Cons:
-Characters needs to be pre-planned, spontaneous characters usually are messed up.
-Classes are unbalance in pvp, there are some classes that works great in pvp while other sucks on it.
-Players need to make a leveling plan if they want to level up together since their is an exp penalization when the difference between players is higher to 10 lvls.
-Dungeons are way too easy (TOO EASY) at the beggining, at high lvl they become harder so it is better.

Everything else in this game is done badly, wrong, stupidly or just plain idiotic. b) Old school 2d
c) Viewed from above

e) MMO

reviewText:
While being an old (and here I thought I was retiring) player of MMORPG, I got intrigued by this game with its Ragnarok style art.

I started logging in immediately yesterday once it was free to play. Of course,  A LOT of players had also started at the same time. The volume of players are too much for the servers and you get kicked out once in a while. And logging in takes a lot of time especially if you're the 300th player in the waiting list.

The lag time was so bad, you can't even talk to the NPCs. I've been clicking a character for five minutes without any progress. Sure there are a lot of channels to choose from in case it lags too much. But in today's game, I logged in on a channel in color white, single circle expecting to have a smoother game play. Sadly, the problem remains the same.

Also, you can't even proceed to the next part of the map since the server is full. I tried jumping around from channel to channel without success. And a crowd is already forming in the entrance/exit to the next map. And well, we were all waiting...and looking bored... to logging out.

The game itself without the moments of lag is pretty awesome. I liked the instant teleportation to the NPC to get your reward once the quest has ended. I also enjoyed choosing and experimenting with the skills set to each job.

I hope that the developers (or whoever) fixes the problems soon. It's too early for me to give up but sooner or later, most gamers would throw in the towel for a smoother play.

reviewText:
Tree of Savior is a love-child between Breath of Fire III and Diablo 2. All the overly cutesy, cartoony 2.5D feel of BoFIII, coated with UI and levelling similar to the old D2 Hacker. I often turn away from blatant anime games and/or ridiculously 'cute' games where supposed threats to your character are along the lines of giant Turnips that smile at you while you're battering them upside the head with a big stick - but on the other hand, I've always enjoyed a game with a grind - one that doesn't just fade away after 50 levels and leave you hanging with lacking end-game.

This'd be far, FAR easier to enjoy if the server wasn't such a mess. Those on EU who decide to play at peak time (or anything earlier than stupid'o'clock in the morning, for that matter) are in for some very, VERY frustrating lag. If you're a night-owl and have no issue with stupidly cute anime trite and are looking for a vast time-sink, ToS may be for you. There's no hand-holding here, so if you've played the likes of Path of Exile, you'll be familiar with the 'trial and error' side of character progression, spread over 300+ levels.

Soundtrack is solid, mostly upbeat ditties and some overbearing dance or trance, but overall it suits the game and can add some enjoyment to the long grind you're in for.

7/10 thus far - and I'm only scratching the surface -- but if the servers don't improve, I have no doubt I'll eventually get tired of slapping things 5 times before actual damage gets registered.

reviewText:
The game has very little to offer beyond longevity. There's no sense of community in the game. There's no zone-wide chat to cooperate with others, there's only global chat (which takes a consumable item to use) or party/guild chat.

As an MMO, it's a failure. The game doesn't rely on healers or tanks for dungeons and missions. Bosses simply get zerged while they mindlessly walk towards their aggro target and use AoE attacks. Healers sometimes can save you when potions are on cooldown, but generally they're unnecessary. Class balance is AWFUL and the AI is really bad, so if you play a pet class be ready for frustration.

Leveling goes up to 280 or so with stat points, skill points, and class progression that you cannot undo (some can be undone with microtransactions, but others cannot). Core gameplay consists of:

Questing - standard uninteresting MMO fair with minimal rewards.
Exploring - small reward for discovering 100% of a zone's map. Very difficult with the base UI, but mods make it less confusing.
Combat - hit a few cooldown with 15-60 second cooldowns. Then procede to auto attack a bunch, even if you're a mage or priest. Then use a mana and/or health potion to continue. There's no challenge to be found at all.
Dungeons/Missions - kill a bunch of trash and then fight several bosses. This gives MUCH more Exp for the time invested than anything else you can do, yet it has a daily limit of 2/3 for each. Basically this is your daily quest."

The game is full of bots spamming their websites in town or in the global channel. Completing quests and grinding Exp can involve more waiting than killing between sitting at a bonfire for SP if you choose to and waiting for monsters to very slowly respawn. There's also the option to camp world bosses that spawn every ~4 hours

reviewText:
After playing this game a while I can confidently say this isn't a good game.

It has some issues with being buggy, being swarmed by gold sellers and such, which can be ignored to some extend. But when gold sellers start to lag your gameplay by spamming, I would have imagined it would be fixed in a month. Haven't noticed any difference in attempt to fix it.

Class system is certainly interesting. It's also major pain in the butt as it's confusing beyond belief. If you happen to make bad pick with class (which is really easy to do, if you haven't studied all the variances) you might not notice it before going a lot further in game. Also not to mention picking wrong class will mean you have to reroll the character as this game is redundantly harsh with picking your route. Picked wrong stat for your build? Too bad, you are out of luck with this game.

As a korean game, it's mindless grindfest. In itself it isn't a problem, but without good dungeon/raids party system and so on it grows old really quick.

I have understood this should be spiritual successor to Ragnarok online, but it seems to miss so many things that made RO good. There isn't same sense of adventure, the same quality of mob design, the same unique sound world. It might be because of nostalgia, but having been playing RO quite frequently, I certainly feel more like playing that than this. All in all, I wouldn't recommend this game to anyone. There is better grindfests out there.

It's hard to think of good qualities to say when bad sides are so numerous.

reviewText:
I make this comment in both English and Chinese.

I spent 49.99$ on exclusive access 3 because I really like this game's fantastic graphic design and impressive music. Moreover, I'm a MMO fan and I spend over 7 years on WOW. To be honest, I'm kind of tired of 3D MMO. Tree of Savior really got my attention. But after nearly 20h game time, I totally change my mind and I realize I spend 50$ purchasing piece of ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•.
So, to be more bojective, let me talk more about its pros and cons.
Pro:
-Beautiful image
-Good BGM
-Classes and skills
-Similar with RO
Con:
-Bad system optimize
-Bad server
-Super lag
-Large lvl gap between different areas
-Bugs
I never expected a perfect early access game experience because I know there should be many problems before open beta. But I am really really upset about its bad server and system optimization. For example, I speak to NPC and after 10mins that NPC makes response. Moreover, FPS is another big problem.
I doubt this game is incomplete.
Don't purchase early access. Even if they cannot solve their server problem or optimize system, you'd better not play this game when it is open beta.

reviewText:
Product received for free

I had high expectations for this, even tho i didnt want to buy early access i was pretty hyped. Now i am happy i didnt. Game has a lot of flaws, most major atm are server issues, euro server is not even that populated and it constantly lags, i am playing archer and i do double dps when it doesnt lag.
‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• auction system - you cant buy/sell anything for 72 hours when you start to play, when you finally can start selling tooltips on items you put on auction(average price and stuff) are completely wrong, you need to check every material(and after 72 hours i had about ~90 of them) manually. But that isnt everything, even if you manage to sell something you need to wait 48 hours to get your silver. This makes absolutely no sense to me.
Other major issue is forced party play. Being in a group gives you more xp then solo. In full group you can get 450% more xp per monster, considering half of the areas are dead/close to dead this makes no sense again. Why should solo gameplay be punished in a grinding game, i have no idea.
Next issue is dungeon queue. Considering you get even more bonus xp(600%) if you dont make premade group for dungeon, you need to queue for some to get good xp. Well, 99% of the time you just gonna stare at 'Searching for party' window for hours if you have nothing else to do. Also game has no info on dungeon locations, but that is tolerable considering queue mechanic itself. Queue should be long distance and not require you to wait at dungeon entrance, period. Oh and 1 more thing about dungeons, 90% of the time you get nothing, there are total 2(+1 when you get premium token) entrances COMBINED per day. Actually its not that bad since you cant even find group for 1 dungeon, lol.

Now about good stuff, art/locations/quests are actually pretty enjoyable, characters are really cute.
But considering party play will probably stay same and I am really not a fan of grinding normal monsters with other people, i have doubts i am gonna enjoy playing this game further.

reviewText:
A Phoenix's Small Guide on Tree of Savior at this current date:

Pros!
Seriously one of the most inspired music BGMs I've heard in any MMO ever. With the exception of a few, I'd seriously buy this game's album and not regret it.
Very intuitive class creation system. Not every mix-matched build or combination will work, but it helps create varied builds between people and freshness when it comes to creating multiple characters.
Great visuals. The game knows tone, and knows when to be happy and prideful, or dark and borderline ambient.
While others may disagree, I like the story, though it isn't magnificently written. This game gets dark, and there will be more times when you can't save others from meeting demise.
Aside from hiccups, the controls are very concise and the game allows multiple interfaces to play it: (Keyboard, Mouse, and Gamepads.)

Cons!
Game is fairly buggy. As of now, some skills and attack may register odd not due to lag, but the nature of the attack itself.
As expected for a global/international game, there is lag. But it is much more than you expect.
Optimization of game is fairly poor. My computer's rig isn't powerful, but it's been known that the game runs on a single core within your computer, so performance is certainly lacking.
Character Customization is fairly lacking thus far. I expect this to be adressed in the future as this isn't a hard thing to fix with time.
The game has a fair amount of linear gameplay, but at the same time one doesn't have to level up the same as others. It's not a sandbox, it is a grinder.

All in all, if you particularly grind based games, I recommend giving it a try and seeing if you like it. It is not for everyone, but for those who end up liking it will get hooked as the core of the game is honestly FANTASTIC. Right now though, lag and bugs may hinder gaming experience. Try it, and support it if you can. This game is not perfect, but it is great and a brilliant way to shine some light on this stale MMO market. If you can get friends for the journey, it may also be worth making a group for it.

Good luck, and may the goddesses stay with you.
